meanings.definition: The power produced by the force of falling or flowing water.
meanings.sent1: The waterpower from the waterfall turned the waterwheel.
meanings.sent2: Hydropower plants use waterpower to generate electricity.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous beavers harnessed the waterpower to build their dam.
meanings.sent4: The waterpower of the river was a relentless force against the rocks.
meanings.sent5: The ancient mill relied on the steady waterpower of the stream.

meanings.definition: The ability of water to generate energy through mechanical means.
meanings.sent1: The waterpower of the waves was used to pump water onto the fields.
meanings.sent2: The waterpower of the dam helped to operate the machinery in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The children marveled at the waterpower of the fountain in the park.
meanings.sent4: The waterpower of the ocean currents was a source of renewable energy.
meanings.sent5: The waterpower of the stream was harnessed to turn the watermill's wheel.
